section.name: Components
section.p: Genjava is a repository of reusable components. The released components are:

tr.td: The largest of the components, Core contains many things dependent on the JDK.
A simple configuration system, primarily for use with a JNDI implementation, such as simple-jndi.
A component for reading and writing comma-separated-value files.
A helper for the Sun java-mail API.
Set of helpers for dealing with HTML and XML without having to parse it.

section.name: Additional components
section.p: Additionally, the following components have been released but are not considered active:

tr.td: A bean introspection library. Unlikely to be worth choosing over Jakarta BeanUtils.
An assortment of widgets and other GUI components. Needs polishing.
A little bit of Servlet helping code, sadly little bit is the right phrase.
Command line tools framework, with a couple of tools. Designed to make it simpler to push out a command line program but probably not too exciting.

section.name: Legacy releases
section.p: For those looking for 'genjava-core' v2.2, the release is available at http://dist.osjava.org/releases/official/genjava-core/.
